episodes.original_body:
Case: Chase-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024
Client: Chase Lindsey

This case appears to be about a motor vehicle accident involving the Lindsey family (Jeremy, Elizabeth, Chase, and Owen). The family is seeking legal representation from the Whaley Law Firm for their personal injury claims.
The most recent activity involves Chase Lindsey sending 12 photos related to the case via text message, which were forwarded to the law firm's project email address. (See details)
A potential red flag is that as of January 6, 2025, the PIP adjuster had not received any completed PIP forms from the Lindsey family, which could delay the processing of their claim. (See details)
The next recommended step is to ensure that the PIP forms are completed and submitted to the insurance company as soon as possible, and to review the photos sent by Chase Lindsey for relevance to the case. (See details), (See details)
episodes.natural_language:
Case Chase-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024 involves a motor vehicle accident involving the Lindsey family, which includes Jeremy Lindsey, Elizabeth Lindsey, Chase Lindsey, and Owen Lindsey. The family is seeking legal representation from the Whaley Law Firm for their personal injury claims.

The most recent activity shows Chase Lindsey sending 12 photos related to the case via text message, which were forwarded to the law firm’s project email address.

A potential red flag is that as of January 6, 2025, the PIP adjuster had not received any completed PIP forms from the Lindsey family, a situation that could delay the processing of their claim.

The next recommended step is to ensure that the PIP forms are completed and submitted to the insurance company as soon as possible, and to review the photos sent by Chase Lindsey for relevance to the case.
episodes.author: Justin Chumbley

Please let me know how you would like to proceed.” The message includes download instructions for a secure file transfer portal: the email states that the site can be accessed only by the email address to which it was sent and directs the recipient to “Please continue all correspondence with your Auto-Owners contact.”

3) Click the files to download them; if there are many files, you may download them all at once by clicking the "Download All" button.

Case: Chase-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024. The client is Chase Lindsey, and the matter concerns the file 300-0793616-2024 for Chase & Owen Lindsey.

On February 18, 2025, Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm wrote to Justin Chumbley (and others) stating that she had downloaded the files and was sending them "here it is." In the same thread, there is a note from approximately 10:47 AM on the same day in which Justin Chumbley asked that the documents be downloaded and emailed to him so he could review them.

Earlier that day, at 10:37 AM, Jessa Galosmo forwarded a message to Aaron Whaley and Justin Chumbley with the subject "Fwd: 300-0793616-2024 Chase & Owen Lindsey," requesting: "Please advise how to proceed."

Also on February 18, 2025, Chandler Wolfe sent a message at about 10:33 AM with the subject "300-0793616-2024 Chase & Owen Lindsey." The message stated: "Please see attached documentation received for Chase & Owen Lindsey. Please let me know how you would like to proceed. Thank you." This message included download instructions for Auto-Owners’ secure file transfer. The instructions explained that the email or download link could be accessed only by the addressed email, and that all further correspondence should continue with the Auto-Owners contact. Steps included:
1) Click the provided link: https://securefiletransfer.aoins.com/message/VOuDkPiynf72Lqh966dO1o
2) Enter your email to receive a Secure Token in a separate email
3) Click the files to download them; if there are multiple files, use "Download All"

The files are available until Monday, 10 March. The message listed two attached files:
- Rawlings Lien, Chase.pdf, 41.1 KB, SHA1 checksum 06502693e3716d93bb991cc3f70f1cfa35c7493fdc5f771a78314422d4b17029
- Rawlings Lien, Owen.pdf, 21.5 KB, SHA1 checksum 78df3469609bc8955e84ff48af33b72f13732676ef7da4b78969181ee4be4bc3

A reference in the message includes the Message ID VOuDkPiynf72Lqh966dO1o. The message also contained a standard confidentiality disclaimer noting that the site contains information that may be privileged or confidential and intended only for the recipient, who agrees not to disclose such information except as allowed by law, and that the recipient will defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Auto-Owners Insurance Company from any damages arising from disclosure or misuse, and will return, delete, and/or destroy all contents after its intended use.

The communication closes with Jessa Galosmo’s sign-off:
All the best,
Jessa Galosmo
Whaley Law Firm
Ph: (502)357-9975
Fax: (502)364-9363

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Chase-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024. Client: Chase Lindsey. The file includes an email thread concerning Jeremy, Owen, Elizabeth, Chase, and related liens, tied to the 12-01-2024 motor vehicle accident involving the Lindsey family.

On February 4, 2025, Chandler Wolfe, a branch claims representative for the Kentucky/PA regional PIP program, sent an email to Jessa Galosmo asking for any updates on medical treatment directions for Jeremy Lindsey, Elizabeth Lindsey, Chase Lindsey, and Owen Lindsey. He noted that, to date, they had only received medical bills for Ms. Elizabeth. His contact details were listed as: phone 800-346-0346 ext. 54628, fax 517-886-8754, email KentuckyPIP.clm@aoins.com, hours 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. EST. He also referenced a “Customer Center” that allows claim information access anytime, anywhere, and included the organization’s standard signature blocks.

Later that same day, Jessa Galosmo replied that they were working on the updates for the Lindsey family. The thread includes prior context from Wolfe noting the request for updated medical treatment directions and reiterating that, to date, only Elizabeth’s medical bills had been received.

Over the following weeks, the thread continued with Wolfe’s follow-up on direction updates for Jeremy, Owen, Chase, and Elizabeth Lindsey. On Friday, March 7, 2025, Wolfe sent another message in which he stated: “Good Morning. I am following up on direction updates for Jeremy, Owen, Chase & Elizabeth Lindsey.” His signature block again provided the Kentucky/PA regional PIP contact information and the note about the Customer Center for claim access.

Jessa Galosmo responded on March 7, 2025 at approximately 11:25 AM, indicating that Jeremy and Owen were already done treating, while Elizabeth and Chase were still receiving treatment. A few minutes later, at around 11:29 AM, Wolfe asked whether Jessa would like him to issue payments on the liens that were received for Owen and Chase.

The email chain was forwarded by Jessa at 11:33 AM under the subject “300-0793616-2024 - JEREMY C LINDSEY” to Aaron Whaley and Justin Chumbley of Whaley Law Firm. The forwarded message included Chandler Wolfe’s inquiry about paying the liens for Owen and Chase and contained the standard Wolfe signature and contact details, along with Jessa’s note reaffirming the status: Jeremy and Owen were done with treatment, while Elizabeth and Chase were still receiving treatment. The forwarded content also repeated the Whaley Law Firm closing and contact information.

In summary: the Lindsey family’s treatment status as of early 2025 showed Jeremy and Owen completed treatment, Elizabeth and Chase still receiving treatment, with ongoing consideration of lien payments for Owen and Chase. The correspondence originated from and circulated among Jessa Galosmo (Whaley Law Firm) and Chandler Wolfe (AO Insurance, KY/PA regional PIP), including updates requested on medical treatment directions and the possibility of issuing lien payments.
episodes.author: Jessa

Treatment update for Elizabeth and Chase

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: RingCentral 
Date: Fri, Mar 14, 2025 at 10:59?AM
Subject: New Voice Message from LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049 on 03/14/2025
10:59 AM
To: Jessa Galosmo 

[image: Logo] [image: Logo]
[image: Logo] Voice Message
------------------------------

Dear Jessa Galosmo,

You have a new voice message:
*From:* LINDSEY JEREMY (502) 424-0049
*Received:* Friday, March 14, 2025 at 10:59 AM
*Length:* 01:12
*To:* (502) 357-9975 Jessa Galosmo

*Voicemail Preview:*
"Hey, good morning. This is Jeremy Lindsey returning your call. I wanted to
provide an update for both Chase and Elizabeth. Chase has a final x ray for
his broken collarbone scheduled for april the second and hopefully we get
final clearance there. No more treatment is needed. But again, he is
scheduled for a final x ray for his collar Bone on april the second.
Elizabeth has continued treatment this following Monday, hoping that is
going to be her last treatment that is been ongoing for several weeks now.
And then she has a final consultation meeting with that orthopedist. I
believe it is in early April as well. I can get to the exact date, but
hopefully her last treatment and then she will have 1 final assessment as
well. So all things considered, assuming there is no changes, we are hoping
to have everyone cleared completely in early to mid April. So I will let
you know as soon as I know more, but that is the update for now. Thank you.
And as always, do not hesitate to reach out to you. Appreciate it."
Listen to this message over your phone or log in to your RingCentral account
 with your main number, extension number,
and password. You can also manage your voicemails in your RingCentral
account.
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Chase-Lindsey-MVA-12-01-2024. Client: Chase Lindsey. On March 14, 2025, a new voice message from Jeremy Lindsey was received and forwarded in the Chase-Lindsey file. The message was sent to Jessa Galosmo and to the Filevine emails for Elizabeth Lindsey and Chase Lindsey, with the forwarding dated March 14, 2025 at 11:10:51 AM (GMT-04:00). The subject of the forwarded item was “Treatment update for Elizabeth and Chase.”

The forwarded note contains a RingCentral voicemail recorded at 10:59 AM on March 14, 2025. In the message, Jeremy Lindsey says he’s returning the call to provide an update for both Chase and Elizabeth. For Chase, he states that a final x-ray for his broken collarbone is scheduled for April 2, and that final clearance is hoped to be obtained at that time. He notes that no more treatment is needed, but reiterates that the final x-ray for the collarbone is scheduled on April 2. For Elizabeth, Jeremy explains that she has continued treatment “this following Monday,” hoping that it will be her last treatment, which has been ongoing for several weeks. Elizabeth is also scheduled for a final consultation meeting with her orthopedist, which Jeremy believes will occur in early April as well; he can provide the exact date but currently hopes this will be her last treatment and she will have one final assessment. Overall, the message conveys that, assuming there are no changes, they are aiming to have everyone cleared completely in early to mid-April. Jeremy promises to relay any further information as soon as he knows more and adds thanks, encouraging Jessa to reach out if needed. The voicemail notes indicate the message was addressed to Jessa Galosmo at the number (502) 357-9975, and that she can manage voicemails through the RingCentral account.

In summary, the update indicates: Chase Lindsey has a final x-ray for his broken collarbone on April 2 with expected final clearance and no further treatment; Elizabeth Lindsey is continuing treatment with the expectation that her last treatment will occur in early April, followed by a final orthopedist consultation and assessment; the team anticipates clearance for all parties by early to mid-April, subject to any changes, with ongoing updates to be provided.
episodes.author: Jessa

about.relevance: subject of treatment update; final x-ray and expected clearance
